Articles.Content: I'm rather lousy disigner and deep space mission planer, a healthy dose of self-criticism never hurt:D but i was wondering does developer introduce some day multiplayer even reduced one. I mean such kind of multiplayer that allow play mission for two pilot, one pilot will fly "carier plane" and drop smaller plane piloted by pilot who will act as Chuck Yeager although I should say Jeb Kerman in KSP case:-)

This isn't going to end well. Multiplayer is number one in the What Not To Suggest list. And there's a suggestion sub-forum.

EDIT: Here it is: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/36863-What-not-to-suggest

You joined in 2012, should already know this.

Edited October 14, 2013 by astropapi1

I think it would be cool to have your friends (if you have any...) controlling some aspect of the spacecraft!

one player could control the steering, one could control staging and so on and so forth.

ZodiaK. Imagine this with space stations when better IVAs come around!

A quick search on the forum would have answer your question.

In the suggestion forum on the what not to suggest list

Major features

  • Multiplayer*

* will not be in (first release of) the game

A simple search on google or the wiki would have bring you to the wiki page.

Currently an officially supported multiplayer mode is not available. Developers have indicated a willingness to revisit multiplayer ideas at a later time only after the game is released from development.

Please don't beat that poor horse. and for now multiplayer on KSP is no.

You can use a mod call Kerbal Live feed.

Or follow those two mods during their develoment.

Working proof from pWolf

The L.O.G. multiplayer project
